comments:
Eclipse version:

    Version: 3.1.0
    Build id: I20050627-1435

I was editing a text file (inside a Java project) and received a
    java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException
when I tried to delete a character. The accompanying message box said:
    "Delete" did not complete normally...

The log indicates:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-09-04 19:44:12.156
!MESSAGE "Delete" did not complete normally.  Please see the log for more 
information.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 99490 ***

Which editor was used?
Can you reproduce?

I used the standard 'text' editor of Eclipse (right click on file name in 
package explorer and 'Open With -> Text Editor'.

Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce the problem on demand, though it happens 
frequently enough to be annoying.

In my case I was editing the file to manually remove tabs (replace with spaces) 
since I don't see any menu option that will let me do that automatically. So I 
was inserting many spaces and new lines (to align), deleting characters 
(overzealous insertion of spaces), and an occasional ctrl-D to delete lines. 
The instance that I reported was actually in response to a line delete (ctrl-D) 
operation.
